title: From Print Volumes to Digital Scholarship: The Handbook of Latin American Studies Web Archive
content: Since the 1930s, the Handbook of Latin American Studies has documented scholarship on Latin America and the Caribbean. In this interview, Tracy North describes how that long-standing mission now extends to web archiving, ensuring long-term access to web-based research materials. The conversation discusses the collaborative process of selecting websites to archive and the behind-the-scenes work involved in developing the collecti
creator: Tracee Haupt Fugate
sourceDescription: Digital Happenings at the Library of Congress
